name: Standing Palm-In One-Arm Dumbbell Press
description: Standing single-arm overhead dumbbell press with palm facing inward (neutral grip).
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. Hold a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height using a neutral grip (palm facing inward). You may hold onto a stable surface with your other hand for balance if needed.

Your starting position has the dumbbell at shoulder height with your elbow bent at approximately 90 degrees and your forearm perpendicular to the floor. Maintain a neutral grip throughout the entire exercise.
While exhaling, press the dumbbell straight up overhead by extending your arm until it is fully extended.
Pause briefly at the top, then while inhaling, slowly lower the weight back down to shoulder height until your arm is at a 90 degree angle again.
Feel the contraction for a second and then repeat the pressing motion.
Complete the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
alternative_names: Standing Palm In One Arm Dumbbell Press
Standing Palm-In Single Arm Dumbbell Press
